paragraphs.content: Chapter 3
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 3

paragraphs.content: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

paragraphs.content: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

paragraphs.content: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

paragraphs.content: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

paragraphs.content: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the Lord, and depart from evil.

paragraphs.content: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

paragraphs.content: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Honour the Lord with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

paragraphs.content: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

paragraphs.content: ¶ My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ My son, despise not the chastening of the Lord; neither be weary of his correction:

paragraphs.content: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For whom the Lord loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

paragraphs.content: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

paragraphs.content: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

paragraphs.content: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

paragraphs.content: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

paragraphs.content: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

paragraphs.content: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

paragraphs.content: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

paragraphs.content: ¶ My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

paragraphs.content: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

paragraphs.content: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

paragraphs.content: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

paragraphs.content: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

paragraphs.content: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

paragraphs.content: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

paragraphs.content: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the froward is abomination to the Lord: but his secret is with the righteous.

paragraphs.content: ¶ The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

paragraphs.content: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

paragraphs.content: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
